comments:
I tried to use the static analysis tool and got the following exception when I tried launching it:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.analysis.core.ui.internal.launch.AnalysisLaunchConfigurationDelegate.buildChildren(AnalysisLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:208)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.analysis.core.ui.internal.launch.AnalysisLaunchConfigurationDelegate.buildSelectionList(AnalysisLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:198)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.analysis.core.ui.internal.launch.AnalysisLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(AnalysisLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:75)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:733)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:931)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)
Changing to appropriate component and owner.  Steve, please have a look at this.
What build were you using?  I can't reproduce this.

You would best to use TPTP 4.2 and Eclipse 3.2.  The bug does not exist with the newer code.

I don't think there are plans for another 4.1.x update so I'm going to close this defect.
